SimpleTemp

This application may help us track the coronavirus. In the absence of sufficient testing, we hope that by crowd-sourcing temperatures, we can identify outbreaks of the virus so that the affected communities can get the help they need.

You may use the app on a single phone to track the temperatures of a few people. When you report a temperature for one of the people you are monitoring, the temperature and a few other details are sent to a central server, for analysis. As more people do it you will be able to see the temperatures of people around you.

Note that nothing in the report sent to the server, can identify you:
  • The report includes a unique identifier. That identifier is encrypted on your phone and can only be decrypted with your password.
  • The report include location information. That information is rounded to the nearest mile.
  • The app has no facility for connecting with other installments on other phones. It cannot report interactions.
Join the SimpleTemp movement and stay safe!

In order to share or view community temperature data, you will have to enable location services. All location data is smudged to an accuracy of no greater than 1km in order to anonymize it. Would you like to turn location services on now?
